Home.title: Nina Mae Louw
Home.intro: I am a full stack developer with a passion for building products that people love. I’m experienced in Ruby on Rails, SQL, Javascript, Ruby and building large and single page front-end applications using React or Vue.js.

section1.title: English Literature & Arts
section1.para: I have a Bachelor’s degree in English Literature, Philosophy and Art History, and a Masters degreee in English Literature from Oxford University. I have highly-developed language and research skills and am a specialist in analyzing large amounts of qualitative data.

section2.title: Programming & Design
section2.para: My coding journey started with Udacity’s Nano degree, then Code Core Bootcamp and Web Design and Development at Van Arts. I have experience building full stack web apps with Ruby, Rails, Javascript, Vue.js, React, jQuery, HTML5 & CSS3, Postgres, and SQL. I have studied UX/UI and interface design principles, and have experience using the Adobe CC suite, Sketch and Invision.

section3.title: Full Stack developer
section3.para: I currently work as a full stack Ruby and Javascript developer at Fresh Prep - taking on responsibilities from upgrading to Bootstrap 4, improving our sign up flow and use of routing APIs, and testing with Selenium and Capybara - to redesigning internal UI interfaces.

section1.title: Research & Strategy
section1.para: I have experience doing graduate-level research and am passionate about user research and user-centred design. I am a convincing and detail-oriented content creator -  I have worked as a copywriter and a freelance photojournalist.

section2.title: Design
section2.para: I have technical experience with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects and Premier, creating mockups with Sketch and creating prototypes with Invision and Adobe XD. I am passionate about user-centred design and enjoy user research, usability testing and designing apps with the user in mind.

section3.title: Front End
section3.para: I have experience with HTML5, CSS3, SASS, Javascript, jQuery, AJAX, React, Redux, Angular.js and Vue.js, testing with Jasmine, Mocha and Jest, and compiling builds with Grunt, Gulp and Webpack. I have recently migrated our web application from jQuery to use Vue.js in order to create a more intuitive and reassuring user experience and increase developer productivity.

section4.title: Back End
section4.para: I have experience with Ruby, PHP, Rails, Laravel, Express.js, Node.js, Postgres, mySQL, MongoDB, Heroku, AWS, Digital Ocean, Redis and testing with Rspec, Cabybara, Selenium and Sauce labs. I am currently tackling refactoring fat models in a Rails codebase and hope to grow towards writing service-oriented code that tries to simplify the behaviour of features.

proj1.title: Pooch Pals
proj1.para: My own business endeavour which allows Vancouverites to borrow local dogs for walks. I have designed and built the minimum viable product using Rails, Vue.js, PostgreSql, Bootstrap and Heroku, and am currently doing more user research and marketing my product.

proj2.title: Mealkit Prototype
proj2.para: An interactive prototype for a meal kit delivery company that focuses on simplifying weekly recipe choices and providing the user with delivery updates. The prototype displays the first two primary tasks decided on after doing user research, creating task models, and running usability tests. Created with Sketch and Invision.

proj3.title: HellKitty Studios
proj3.para: Web application created for client comic artists Pia Guerra and Ian Boothby. The web app allows them to update content on their landing page, as well as updating content in their respective galleries and profiles. Built using Rails, AJAX, jQuery, Postgresql and Bootstrap.

proj4.title: Full Circle Goals
proj4.para: A goal-tracking app that allows you to set yourself a goal routine. It includes a visualization of your daily goals and a consecutive days completed progress bar. The app uses a Rails API, React.js, AJAX, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Materialize-UI and PostgreSQL.

proj5.title: Vote Up
proj5.para: Group project at Vanarts - we were tasked to build a website to increase voter awareness amongst the Candian youth. The web app includes map-based search of country-wide MPs, and a voting on policies poitical leanings test. Built with SASS, Jade, Javascript, jQuery and Gulp.

proj6.title: Food Finder
proj6.para: Food Explorer is a SAP that uses Knockout.js and a MVVM pattern for the app architecture and a responsive UI. It uses Google Maps API and Foursquare API for the map functionality and to allow users to search for keywords and receive helpful food-related data about places in Vancouver.
